result.execSummary:
Wilson Rivera was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Wilson Rivera was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wilson Rivera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Wilson Rivera in court with attorney J A Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is prepared to waive extradition. Defense requests one more week to turn himself in to authorities in Alabama. Defendant is prepared to sign the waiver of extradition. Waiver of extradition filed. Court signs the waiver. Defendant taken into custody. Monies posted to be returned to the poster. Authorities to be contacted by the end of the day. Court will set the matter for review hearing to see if the defendant has been turned over to the proper authorities.  Review hearing scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Extradition hearing on July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Wilson Rivera in court with attorney J A Rosario.  Barbara A Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosario addresses defendant's lawyer in Alabama and requests another hearing in a few weeks. Defendant is contesting extradition at this time. Court will set an extradition hearing.  Extradition hearing scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Warrant for Commitment signed by Judge Hassin.

Defendant Wilson Rivera in court with attorney J A Rosario.  Susan L Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Rosario states the defendant has retained an Attorney in Alabama and are reviewing his case there. Warrant for commitment filed by State and the State is requesting the Court to sign the document. Atty. Rosario requests the court not to sign it. Court signs the warrant for commitment. Parties copied.  Court will give another date.  Hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Defendant Wilson Rivera in court, in custody, with attorney J A Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 09:30 am.
